titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Jesse Hurd Family Papers
titlestmt.author: compiled by William E. Brown, Jr.

publicationstmt.publisher: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on Thursday January 10, 2019 at 08:44

repository.corpname: Yale University. Department of Manuscripts and Archives

did.abstract: The papers consist of correspondence, diaries, legal papers, account books, ship's papers, and miscellanea relating to the private lives and business interests of the Hurd family of Chatham, Connecticut, and New York, New York. Family interests in shipbuilding, ship repair, mercantile holdings, distillery operations, and politics are detailed, with extensive records for the New York Screw Dock Company and for many of the ships built, owned, and operated by the Hurd family.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Jesse Hurd Family Papers (MS 295). Manuscripts and Archives, Yale University Library.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: Arranged in three series: I. Correspondence and Papers, 1774-1853. II. Business Papers, 1700-1910. III. Ship's Papers, 1791-1831.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The Jesse Hurd Family Papers consist of correspondence, diaries, legal papers, account books, ship's papers, and miscellanea relating to the private lives and business interests of the Hurd family of Chatham, Connecticut, and New York, New York. Family interests in shipbuilding, ship repair, mercantile holdings, distillery operations, and politics are detailed, with extensive records for the operations of the New York Screw Dock Company and for many of the ships built, owned, and operated by the Hurd family.

accessrestrict.head: Conditions Governing Access
accessrestrict.p: The materials are open for research.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Three generations of the Hurd family of Chatham, Connecticut, are represented in the papers. The primary figures are Jesse Hurd (1760-1831); his brother Benjamin Hurd (1739-1781); Jesse's sons Jesse II, Cyrus, and Nelson; and Cyrus Hurd's sons Cyrus II and Charles W.B. Hurd.
Jesse Hurd was a storekeeper, distiller, ship builder, shipmaster, shipowner, state representative from Chatham, and first president of the New York Screw Dock Company (1827-1831).
Nathaniel Lynde Griswold (1773-1866); George Griswold (1776-1859), and Huntington Selden are also represented in the papers, in relation to their business dealings with the Hurd family.
For a chart outlining the genealogical relations of the Hurd family, please consult theGenealogical Chart.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Unpublished materials authored or otherwise produced by the creator(s) of this collection are in the public domain. There are no restrictions on use. Copyright status for other collection materials is unknown. Transmission or reproduction of materials protected by U.S. Copyright Law (Title 17, U.S.C.) beyond that allowed by fair use requires the written permission of the copyright owners. Works not in the public domain cannot be commercially exploited without permission of the copyright owners. Responsibility for any use rests exclusively with the user.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains letters, diaries, legal papers and other materials documenting the activities of family members. Correspondence includes letters relating to the War of 1812, to events in Chatham and Haddam, Connecticut, and to the business pursuits of Jesse Hurd and others. Cyrus Hurd's letters from California (1849-1853) and Charles W.B. Hurd's letters prior to the Civil War battle at Antietam (1861-1862) are also arranged here. Correspondence from South America, Cuba, China, and elsewhere reflect the family's widespread shipping interests. The vagaries of maritime life detailed in letters include ship orders, foreign markets, ship sales, shipwrecks, credit needs, piracy, and financial considerations. Correspondents include: Huntington Selden, Captain Hezekiah Smith, Captain Stephen Griffith, David and Abijah Brainerd, and others.

Diaries arranged in the collection (box 2) include Jesse Hurd's notes on his years in the Connecticut General Assembly (1808-1809), Cyrus Hurd II's Brazilian voyage (1826-1827), Cyrus Hurd, Sr.'s United States trip to the western frontier (1836), and Charles W.B. Hurd's Civil War diary (1861-1862).

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series contains material arranged alphabetically by record type.

did.unittitle: Hurd, Cyrus, Sr.: U.S. western trip

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series includes information on three areas of Hurd family business dealings. General files contain several account books (boxes 3-5) detailing Jesse Hurd's financial transactions in Chatham, Connecticut, and elsewhere. Bills and receipts (boxes 6-9) provide similar financial information. Distillery files consist of bills relating to the Hurds' business activities in Connecticut, including the purchase of goods to produce liquor. New York Screw Dock Company files include accounts of workers wages and hours, legal papers, and miscellanea relating to the operations of this company. The company owned three docks and the apparatus to remove ships from the water to effect repairs and cleaning. Legal papers note the liquidation of the company stock in 1910.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series is arranged in three sections: General, Distillery, and New York Screw Dock Company. Each section is arranged alphabetically by record type.

did.unittitle: Accounts of worker's wages and hours

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series contains financial data, construction, cargo, repair and outfitting information for more than seventy-five (75) vessels (ships, brigs, sloops, schooners) that members of the Hurd family owned, operated, sailed, or repaired. Material pertaining to the Bolivar is extensive, with financial records and correspondence with the Griswolds. The diary of Cyrus Hurd II details one of this brig's voyages.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This series contains files arranged alphabetically by the name of the vessel.
